title: Man charged in double shooting of 9-year-old boy, mother
content:
FLINT, MI -- A Flint man has been charged in the shooting of a 9-year-old boy and his mother.
Martin Vincent Depew Jr., 18 of Flint, has been charged and arraigned in connection to the shooting, according to a news release from the Flint Police Department.
Depew has been charged with two counts of assault with intent to murder, two counts of firearm discharge from a vehicle, carrying a concealed weapon, and felony firearms, according to 67th District Court records.
On Sunday, April 17 around 7:30 p.m. Flint police responded to the 1900 block of Greenbrook Lane for a shooting. When officers arrived they found two victims -- a woman and her 9-year-old son had been shot.
Police said the victims were innocent bystanders who were walking in the area when they were shot. The mother and son were transported to an area hospital where they were listed in good condition.
A second suspect has also been arrested and charges are pending review by the Genesee County Prosecutor's Office, according to the release.
Anyone with information is asked to call Flint police at 810-237-6800, or to submit an anonymous tip call Crime Stoppers at 1-800-422-JAIL.
Amanda Emery is a police reporter for MLive-The Flint Journal. Contact her at aemery@mlive.com or 810-285-0792. Follow her on Twitter or Facebook.
